{"page": 0, "page_count": 20457, "items_per_page": 20, "took": 29, "timed_out": false, "total": 409126, "results": [{"contents": "

Siemens Mobility Portugal is looking for an experiencedSenior Software Architect to join our architecture team for RealtimeDispatching Systems. In this role, your key responsibilities will be:

  • Design and develop of software architecture fornew and existing products
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams,including product management and agile development teams, to gatherrequirements, create technical specifications, and specify technical solutionsfor new requirements and product features
  • Break down solutions for implementation indevelopment teams, providing guidance and coaching
  • Document and maintain the technical productarchitecture
  • Coordinate and monitor the implementation ofarchitecture activities across product and project boundaries
  • Mentor and guide team members in software design anddevelopment best practices
  • Ensure that software code meets quality standards, includingperformance, security, and reliability
  • Stay up to date with industry trends and newtechnologies, continuously improving software design and development processes
  • Contribute to a healthy and collaborative teamspirit within the large, interdisciplinary product teams based in Aveiro and Hanover(Germany) as well as other Siemens Mobility's locations worldwide.

Requirements:

  • Abachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field
  • Atleast 6 years of experience in software design and development
  • Experienceas a software architect, preferably with certification according to iSAQB orsimilar
  • Proficiency in at least one OOP programminglanguage, such as C++ or Java, with a strong understanding of OOP and softwaredesign patterns
  • Experience designing and implementingmulti-tier and distributed component/service architectures, as well as workingwith cloud technologies
  • Knowledgein Continuous Integration/Delivery practices and tools
  • Excellent communication and moderation skillsin English, with the ability to produce high quality written documentation
  • A solution-oriented and independent workingstyle, with the ability to mentor and guide other team members

If you are an experienced software architect with apassion for solving complex problems and building scalable and reliablesoftware solutions, we encourage you to apply by submitting your resume.

Organization: Siemens Mobility

Company: SIEMENS MOBILITY, UNIPESSOAL LDA

Experience Level: Experienced Professional

Full / Part time: Full-time

", "name": "Senior Software Architect(m/f/d)", "type": "external", "publication_date": "2023-01-03T23:34:15Z", "short_name": "senior-software-architectmfd", "model_type": "jobs", "id": 10654819, "locations": [{"name": "Aveiro, Portugal"}], "categories": [{"name": "Software Engineering"}], "levels": [{"name": "Senior Level", "short_name": "senior"}], "tags": [], "refs": {"landing_page": "https://www.themuse.com/jobs/siemens/senior-software-architectmfd"}, "company": {"id": 11913, "short_name": "siemens", "name": "Siemens"}}, {"contents": "

Art der Anstellung: Befristet; 15-20h /Woche

Deine Extraportion Praxis.

Wie werden wir uns übermorgen fortbewegen, miteinander kommunizieren, Energien nutzen? Lass uns gemeinsam an den Antworten arbeiten. Wir suchen dafür kluge Köpfe, die Theorie in Praxis umwandeln und clever mitdenken. Kurz: Menschen, die ihre und unsere Fragen in neue Ausrufezeichen verwandeln wollen! Als Werkstudent*in stehen dir bei uns viele Türen offen, um dich einzubringen: Ergreife die Chance und werde Teil unseres weltweiten Netzwerks, knüpfe wichtige Kontakte und lege so den Grundstein für deine berufliche und persönliche Zukunft. Unsere Teams freuen sich auf dich.

CF F Trade Finance Advisory (TFA) hat als Governance Owner für Trade Finance innerhalb von Siemens die Aufgabe, einen effektiven und effizienten Risikorahmen für das Trade Finance Geschäft von Siemens zu schaffen und die mit Garantien, Akkreditiven und Treuhandkonten verbundenen Risiken zu verwalten.

TFA Global Coordination and Development (GCD) analysiert und optimiert kontinuierlich das globale Trade Finance Setup, alle Prozesse und die dazugehörige IT-Landschaft mit einem starken Fokus auf Prozesseffizienz, Standardisierung, Automatisierung und Digitalisierung. GCD unterstützt den Global Head of TFA bei der Entwicklung und Umsetzung einer globalen TFA-Strategie sowie bei der Konzeption und Umsetzung von strategischen Projekten. GCD ist außerdem für die Koordination der globalen Trade Finance Organisation und die Konzeption und Umsetzung eines Kommunikationskonzepts für die internen und externen Stakeholder von TFA verantwortlich.

Wir setzen um, worauf es ankommt. Das ist dein Beitrag.

  • Du unterstützt den Bereich Trade Finance bei der Entwicklung und Umsetzung eines internen als auch externen Kommunikationskonzeptes
  • Du übernimmst IT-Administrationsaufgaben für

", "name": "Senior Software Architect(m/f/d)", "type": "external", "publication_date": "2023-01-03T23:34:15Z", "short_name": "senior-software-architectmfd", "model_type": "jobs", "id": 10654819, "locations": [{"name": "Aveiro, Portugal"}], "categories": [{"name": "Software Engineering"}], "levels": [{"name": "Senior Level", "short_name": "senior"}], "tags": [], "refs": {"landing_page": "https://www.themuse.com/jobs/siemens/senior-software-architectmfd"}, "company": {"id": 11913, "short_name": "siemens", "name": "Siemens"}}, {"contents": "

Art der Anstellung: Befristet; 15-20h /Woche

Deine Extraportion Praxis.

Wie werden wir uns übermorgen fortbewegen, miteinander kommunizieren, Energien nutzen? Lass uns gemeinsam an den Antworten arbeiten. Wir suchen dafür kluge Köpfe, die Theorie in Praxis umwandeln und clever mitdenken. Kurz: Menschen, die ihre und unsere Fragen in neue Ausrufezeichen verwandeln wollen! Als Werkstudent*in stehen dir bei uns viele Türen offen, um dich einzubringen: Ergreife die Chance und werde Teil unseres weltweiten Netzwerks, knüpfe wichtige Kontakte und lege so den Grundstein für deine berufliche und persönliche Zukunft. Unsere Teams freuen sich auf dich.

CF F Trade Finance Advisory (TFA) hat als Governance Owner für Trade Finance innerhalb von Siemens die Aufgabe, einen effektiven und effizienten Risikorahmen für das Trade Finance Geschäft von Siemens zu schaffen und die mit Garantien, Akkreditiven und Treuhandkonten verbundenen Risiken zu verwalten.

TFA Global Coordination and Development (GCD) analysiert und optimiert kontinuierlich das globale Trade Finance Setup, alle Prozesse und die dazugehörige IT-Landschaft mit einem starken Fokus auf Prozesseffizienz, Standardisierung, Automatisierung und Digitalisierung. GCD unterstützt den Global Head of TFA bei der Entwicklung und Umsetzung einer globalen TFA-Strategie sowie bei der Konzeption und Umsetzung von strategischen Projekten. GCD ist außerdem für die Koordination der globalen Trade Finance Organisation und die Konzeption und Umsetzung eines Kommunikationskonzepts für die internen und externen Stakeholder von TFA verantwortlich.

Wir setzen um, worauf es ankommt. Das ist dein Beitrag.

  • Du unterstützt den Bereich Trade Finance bei der Entwicklung und Umsetzung eines internen als auch externen Kommunikationskonzeptes
  • Du übernimmst IT-Administrationsaufgaben für

Mechanical Assembler

Siemens is a global technology powerhouse that has stood for engineering excellence, innovation, quality, reliability, and internationality for more than 165 years. Siemens Smart Infrastructure is seeking an Mechanical Assembler for our Electrification and Automation (EA) Business Unit working with the Low Voltage Motor Control Center product.

As a Mechanical Assembler you will be responsible for the building, assembling, and wiring of Medium and Low Voltage Electrical Distribution Equipment, such as LV Motor Control Centers, MV breakers, MV switchgear and Motor Control Centers, DC Electrical Vehicle Chargers and Solar Inverters.

Responsibilities:

  • Assembly and wire LV MCC breakers, structures, sub-assemblies, parts kits, and aftermarket parts orders
  • Perform Sub assembly work including mechanical assembly of steel and components, control wiring, power cable work, and interconnection of control wires
  • Record appropriate job record transactions
  • Read BOM, follow layouts & assembly drawings,
  • Perform some basic wiring per given instructions when requested
  • Set and correct use of Torque wrenches
  • Adhere to developed processes, methods and/or seek ways to improve
  • Must adhere to all safety rules and keep safety first for self and others
  • Perform miscellaneous other duties as assigned by Supervisor or Management

Requirements: knowledge/skills, education, and experience:

  • High School Diploma or GED
  • 1+ years of experience performing mechanical assembly or experience in the mechanical field
  • 1+ years' experience wiring in commercial or industrial applications
  • Must be able to lift parts or sub-assemblies that weigh up to 50 lbs. occasionally
  • Communicate in English (read, write & speak fluently)
  • Must be able to Identify mechanical parts and electrical components
  • Experience with using a tape measure and other measuring devices
  • Must have extensive experience working with standard hand and power tools, both pneumatic and battery operated, 1 to 3 years

Siemens Mobility Portugal is looking for an experiencedSenior Software Architect to join our architecture team for RealtimeDispatching Systems. In this role, your key responsibilities will be:

  • Design and develop of software architecture fornew and existing products
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams,including product management and agile development teams, to gatherrequirements, create technical specifications, and specify technical solutionsfor new requirements and product features
  • Break down solutions for implementation indevelopment teams, providing guidance and coaching
  • Document and maintain the technical productarchitecture
  • Coordinate and monitor the implementation ofarchitecture activities across product and project boundaries
  • Mentor and guide team members in software design anddevelopment best practices
  • Ensure that software code meets quality standards, includingperformance, security, and reliability
  • Stay up to date with industry trends and newtechnologies, continuously improving software design and development processes
  • Contribute to a healthy and collaborative teamspirit within the large, interdisciplinary product teams based in Aveiro and Hanover(Germany) as well as other Siemens Mobility's locations worldwide.

Requirements:

  • Abachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field
  • Atleast 6 years of experience in software design and development
  • Experienceas a software architect, preferably with certification according to iSAQB orsimilar
  • Proficiency in at least one OOP programminglanguage, such as C++ or Java, with a strong understanding of OOP and softwaredesign patterns
  • Experience designing and implementingmulti-tier and distributed component/service architectures, as well as workingwith cloud technologies
  • Knowledgein Continuous Integration/Delivery practices and tools
  • Excellent communication and moderation skillsin English, with the ability to produce high quality written documentation
  • A solution-oriented and independent workingstyle, with the ability to mentor and guide other team members

If you are an experienced software architect with apassion for solving complex problems and building scalable and reliablesoftware solutions, we encourage you to apply by submitting your resume.

Organization: Siemens Mobility

Company: SIEMENS MOBILITY, UNIPESSOAL LDA

Experience Level: Experienced Professional

Full / Part time: Full-time

", "name": "Senior Software Architect(m/f/d)", "type": "external", "publication_date": "2023-01-03T23:34:15Z", "short_name": "senior-software-architectmfd", "model_type": "jobs", "id": 10654819, "locations": [{"name": "Aveiro, Portugal"}], "categories": [{"name": "Software Engineering"}], "levels": [{"name": "Senior Level", "short_name": "senior"}], "tags": [], "refs": {"landing_page": "https://www.themuse.com/jobs/siemens/senior-software-architectmfd"}, "company": {"id": 11913, "short_name": "siemens", "name": "Siemens"}}, {"contents": "

Art der Anstellung: Befristet; 15-20h /Woche

Deine Extraportion Praxis.

Wie werden wir uns übermorgen fortbewegen, miteinander kommunizieren, Energien nutzen? Lass uns gemeinsam an den Antworten arbeiten. Wir suchen dafür kluge Köpfe, die Theorie in Praxis umwandeln und clever mitdenken. Kurz: Menschen, die ihre und unsere Fragen in neue Ausrufezeichen verwandeln wollen! Als Werkstudent*in stehen dir bei uns viele Türen offen, um dich einzubringen: Ergreife die Chance und werde Teil unseres weltweiten Netzwerks, knüpfe wichtige Kontakte und lege so den Grundstein für deine berufliche und persönliche Zukunft. Unsere Teams freuen sich auf dich.

CF F Trade Finance Advisory (TFA) hat als Governance Owner für Trade Finance innerhalb von Siemens die Aufgabe, einen effektiven und effizienten Risikorahmen für das Trade Finance Geschäft von Siemens zu schaffen und die mit Garantien, Akkreditiven und Treuhandkonten verbundenen Risiken zu verwalten.

TFA Global Coordination and Development (GCD) analysiert und optimiert kontinuierlich das globale Trade Finance Setup, alle Prozesse und die dazugehörige IT-Landschaft mit einem starken Fokus auf Prozesseffizienz, Standardisierung, Automatisierung und Digitalisierung. GCD unterstützt den Global Head of TFA bei der Entwicklung und Umsetzung einer globalen TFA-Strategie sowie bei der Konzeption und Umsetzung von strategischen Projekten. GCD ist außerdem für die Koordination der globalen Trade Finance Organisation und die Konzeption und Umsetzung eines Kommunikationskonzepts für die internen und externen Stakeholder von TFA verantwortlich.

Wir setzen um, worauf es ankommt. Das ist dein Beitrag.

  • Du unterstützt den Bereich Trade Finance bei der Entwicklung und Umsetzung eines internen als auch externen Kommunikationskonzeptes
  • Du übernimmst IT-Administrationsaufgaben für Chatbots

{"page": 1, "page_count": 2091, "items_per_page": 20, "took": 23, "timed_out": false, "total": 41812, "results": [{"contents": "

We are seeking a professional SAP CS SD Techno Functional Expert with a proven track record of leading internal complex medium to large-scale projects in the healthcare services area. Knowledge and experience with customer services business processes & Agile, ITIL V3.0 framework is important to drive multiple projects as part of project portfolio.

The role of SAP CS SD Techno Functional Expert is to plan, execute, and finalize projects according to scope, deadline and budget, as well as manage ongoing IT operations activities by following ITIL Based ITSM Processes. This includes directing resources in a matrixed organization and coordinating the efforts of team members to deliver projects according to plan. The expert individual will also define the project's objectives, participate in projects planning and oversee quality control throughout its life cycle.

Responsibilities

  • Define project scope, goals and deliverables that support the business goals and requirements in collaboration with colleagues, senior management, and stakeholders from Customer Services team.
  • Facilitate Gap analysis and Business process mapping \"As Is\" vs \"To Be\" workshops with IT and Business Partners.
  • Help visualize big picture of End-to-End Service setup to provide technical design for project that requires strong technical knowledge of ERP SAP CS / SD module & field services mobile solutions and other web-based solutions.
  • Own regional technical design specification following template governance model is created/reviewed and implemented in country rollout based on Global template model - SAP customer service design.
  • Proactively manage changes in project scope to maximize success and minimize risk to stakeholders and the company.
  • Meet with stakeholders to take detailed objectives and clarify specific requirements for the agreed scope of the project(s).
  • Develop complete project plans and/or contribute into Global Project plan
  • Liaise with project stakeholders on an ongoing basis.
  • Develop and deliver progress reports, proposals, requirements documentation, and presentations.
  • Identify and manage project dependencies and critical path to ensure timely delivery.
  • Report and escalate to IT management as needed.
  • Ability to work well under pressure and time driven management expectations
  • self-motivation , competitive, results-driven attitude , passion, dedication and focused individual
  • time-management skills and the ability to prioritize your workload
  • confident presentation skills & ability to pay attention to detail

Requirements

  • 10+ years of Techno Functional experience in Customer Services area preferably in SAP SD and/or SAP CS modules. Hands-on expertise in SAP SD and/or CS modules required.
  • Should have Multiple Years and Multiple Projects/Clients experience in configuration of SD and CS Module including Integration with Finance/Controlling, Material Management modules.
  • Should have experience with at least 2-3 large scale SAP migration or consolidation
  • Should have strong experience in functional design and technical design specification in area of user exits, Pricing requirements, RFCs, RRB, Revenue Recognition, Maintenance Service Contract etc.
  • Communicate with the business SMEs to understand the Customer Service processes and able to provide IT solutions.
  • Communicate with App developers and SAP development team on various issues, changes, and projects. Strong knowledge for the interfaces from/to SAP applications to CRM, Mobile applications etc.
  • Participate in Release Management and Projects and write technical requirement specification documents to provide to UI App developers and SAP backend team.
  • Experience of managing small to medium scale projects/Changes in different technologies like SAP, ServiceNow, Mobile technologies
  • Documentation of Work specifications, co-ordinate and able to work with other IT departments for various projects or in resolving tickets/ issues.
  • Technical solution (Dev op, SolMan), expertise is required
  • 10% travel is required

Organization: Siemens Healthineers

Company: Siemens Medical Solutions USA, Inc.

Experience Level: Experienced Professional

Full / Part time: Full-time

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement
Siemens is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, creed, religion, national origin, citizenship status, ancestry, sex, age, physical or mental disability unrelated to ability, marital status, family responsibilities, pregnancy, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity, transgender, sex stereotyping, order of protection status, protected veteran or military status, or an unfavorable discharge from military service, and other categories protected by federal, state or local law.

Siemens follows Executive Order 11246, including the Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision. To learn more, Click here.

Let'smake the difference together!

SiemensDigital Industries (DI) is an innovation leader in automation anddigitalization. Closely, collaborating with partners and customers, we careabout the digital transformation in the process and discrete industries. Withour Digital Enterprise portfolio, we provide and encourage companies of allsizes with an end-to-end set of products, solutions and services to integrateand digitalize the entire value chain. Meaningful optimization for the specificneeds of each industry, our outstanding portfolio supports customers to achievegreater efficiency and flexibility. We are constantly adding innovations to itsportfolio to integrate groundbreaking future technologies. We have our globalheadquarters in Nuremberg, Germany, and have around 75,000 employeesinternationally.

We offera role with responsibility, independence and the possibility to contributeproactive. We foster a teamwork culture with room for individual development

Pleasevisit https://www.siemens.com/plm.

About therole / Segment

It's anexciting time here at Siemens Digital Industries. To support our growthIndustry 4.0 portfolio in both discrete and process industries, the PortfolioDevelopment department in Mexico is looking for a Portfolio Developer for theAerospace Industry.

Theobjective of the Portfolio Development function is to ensure that our salesorganization achieves assigned revenue targets for each solution in ourPortfolio. The Portfolio development role achieves the objective by creatingand maintaining plans for their assigned product or solution domain withintheir defined territory, aligning those plans with collaborators across sales,the segments and industry strategy. Further, they drive the execution of thoseplans through the appropriate sales functions.

Area ofresponsibility

  • Build and maintain a business plan for the specific portfolio elements that supports and aligns with the Country Plan, while ensuring these plans are aligned with marketing, sales, etc.
  • Identify and select the most appropriate global and local Campaigns for their chosen portfolio.
  • Use market analysis tools to identify suspect accounts (portfolio suspects).
  • Collaborate with a sales orchestrator or a tele-prospector for mature contacts for the suspects, and ultimately fill the pipeline with opportunities generated from the suspects.
  • Collaborate with our Partners for their enablement on the selected Campaigns and the development of suspect opportunities and, this way, boost their business on assigned portfolio.
  • Develop and engage in multiple opportunities, primarily in the identify and discover stage of the sales process.
  • Provide feedback and suggestions for improvements on specific local and global Campaigns as well as additional needs of their territory to the zone or global PfD.
  • Ensure adequate awareness and education for the entire chosen Portfolio within the country organization.
  • Working together to optimize production processes within the Digital Enterprise, focusing on improving efficiency, flexibility and time-to-market (more information: https://new.siemens.com/global/en/company/about/businesses/digital-industries.html)

Your qualifications

• Bachelor/master's degree in industrial, aeronautical or other relevantengineering.

• 5+ years of proven experience in SW or engineering companies, preferablyin business development, presales or sales positions.

• Understanding of PLM andindustrial software.

• Proven background in Product Lifecycle Management software, preferablyincluding Siemens Industry Software products.

• Knowledge of the Mexican Aerospace industrial landscape .

• Strong customer orientation, communication, enthusiasm and persuasionskills.

• Focused on results and quality, with strong decision-making ability andorganizational skills.

  • Experience aligning with mid/upper level management and technical users.
  • Documented experience of owning and managing discovery phase withclients.
  • Collaborate and drive results with diverse teams across multipleinternal and external organizations.

• Knowledge driven behavior, analytical approach, flexible,internationally oriented.

• Approximately 50% travel.

• Fluent Spanish and English.

Workingat Siemens Software

Why us?

Workingat Siemens Software means flexibility - Choosing between working at home andthe office at other times is the norm here. We offer great benefits andrewards, as you'd expect from a world leader in industrial software.

We are anequal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminateon the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, genderexpression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, ordisability status.

AtSiemens, we are always challenging ourselves to build a better future. We needthe most innovative and diverse Digital Minds to develop tomorrow's reality.

SiemensIndustry Software is an equal opportunities employer and does not discriminateunlawfully on the grounds of age, disability, gender assignment, marriage, andcivil partnership, pregnancy and parental, race, religion or belief, sex,sexual orientation, or trade union membership.

Siemens.Making real what matters

If youwant to make a difference - make it with us!

At Siemens we are always challengingourselves to build a better future. We need the most innovative anddiverse Digital Minds to develop tomorrow's reality. Find out more aboutthe Digital world of Siemens here: www.siemens.com/care

We are accelerating and securing the energy transition sustainably and profitably.

Siemens Smart Infrastructure Grid Software is leading the way in this energy transformation with a comprehensive portfolio that addresses key challenges surrounding resiliency, reliability, affordability and security requirements for our customers.

Are you passionate about creating new possibilities?

This position is part of our Siemens Power Technologies International (PTI) team. PTI is a world leader in power system analysis and provides advanced technical consulting services, world-standard analytical software programs, and professional education in power systems engineering.

We are seeking a Power Systems Consultant to join our Power System Consulting team and contribute to the planning and integration of renewables, storage, and FACTS to the electrical grid. The consultant will be working remotely in the United States for our PTI United States team.

Work options include local or fully remote anywhere in the US.
It's your role, here's the part you can play:
The core responsibilities of the Power Systems Consultant include the application of power systems planning principles, simulation and analysis of power system transient and sub-transient behaviors. In addition, the consultant will prepare reports and presentation of the study results and provide recommendation accordingly. In this role, it is crucial for the consultant to develop and maintain a strong relationship with our customers through ongoing communication. The successful candidate requires great problem-solving skills enabling quality and accuracy in a project environment. Attention to detail is a success factor.

Further responsibilities:

  • Perform power system transient analysis using appropriate RMS and EMT software tools to evaluate integration of renewable generation, battery energy storage, and FACTS
  • Prepare detailed written reports describing analyses performed, conclusions, and recommendations
  • Organize and lead small project teams ensuring deliverables are of high quality and projects are completed within budget and schedule
  • Develop automation scripts to improve the speed and accuracy of simulations and analysis
  • Provide EMT technical leadership and share knowledge with colleagues
  • Support proposal preparation by developing project plans, budgets, and timelines

Be part of our team, here's what's needed:

  • Master's degree or PhD degree in Electrical Engineering with a specialization in Power and Energy Systems
  • A minimum of 6 years of relevant experience in the electric power industry
  • In-depth knowledge of transmission system planning and/or operations
  • Industry experience performing transient analysis using PSCAD/EMTDC or EMTP-RV
  • Great English written and spoken communication skills are required

Preferred Qualifications:

About therole / Segment

It's anexciting time here at Siemens Digital Industries. To support our growthIndustry 4.0 portfolio in both discrete and process industries, the PortfolioDevelopment department in Mexico is looking for a Portfolio Developer for theAerospace Industry.

Theobjective of the Portfolio Development function is to ensure that our salesorganization achieves assigned revenue targets for each solution in ourPortfolio. The Portfolio development role achieves the objective by creatingand maintaining plans for their assigned product or solution domain withintheir defined territory, aligning those plans with collaborators across sales,the segments and industry strategy.   • Ensure adequate awareness and education for the entire chosen Portfolio within the country organization.

We are accelerating and securing the energy transition sustainably and profitably.

Siemens Smart Infrastructure Grid Software is leading the way in this energy transformation with a comprehensive portfolio that addresses key challenges surrounding resiliency, reliability, affordability and security requirements for our customers.

Are you passionate about creating new possibilities?

This position is part of our Siemens Power Technologies International (PTI) team. PTI is a world leader in power system analysis and provides advanced technical consulting services, world-standard analytical software programs, and professional education in power systems engineering.

We are seeking a Power Systems Consultant to join our Power System Consulting team and contribute to the planning and integration of renewables, storage, and FACTS to the electrical grid. The consultant will be working remotely in the United States for our PTI United States team.

Work options include local or fully remote anywhere in the US.
It's your role, here's the part you can play:
The core responsibilities of the Power Systems Consultant include the application of power systems planning principles, simulation and analysis of power system transient and sub-transient behaviors. In addition, the consultant will prepare reports and presentation of the study results and provide recommendation accordingly. In this role, it is crucial for the consultant to develop and maintain a strong relationship with our customers through ongoing communication. The successful candidate requires great problem-solving skills enabling quality and accuracy in a project environment. Attention to detail is a success factor.

Further responsibilities:

  • Perform power system transient analysis using appropriate RMS and EMT software tools to evaluate integration of renewable generation, battery energy storage, and FACTS
  • Prepare detailed written reports describing analyses performed, conclusions, and recommendations
  • Organize and lead small project teams ensuring deliverables are of high quality and projects are completed within budget and schedule
  • Develop automation scripts to improve the speed and accuracy of simulations and analysis
  • Provide EMT technical leadership and share knowledge with colleagues
  • Support proposal preparation by developing project plans, budgets, and timelines

Be part of our team, here's what's needed:

  • Master's degree or PhD degree in Electrical Engineering with a specialization in Power and Energy Systems
  • A minimum of 6 years of relevant experience in the electric power industry
  • In-depth knowledge of transmission system planning and/or operations
  • Industry experience performing transient analysis using PSCAD/EMTDC or EMTP-RV
  • Great English written and spoken communication skills are required

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience evaluating transient stability of large transmission systems using PSS®E, TSAT, or PSLF
  • Experience developing scripts to automate execution and analysis of simulations

We've got a lot to offer:

We are accelerating and securing the energy transition sustainably and profitably.

Siemens Smart Infrastructure Grid Software is leading the way in this energy transformation with a comprehensive portfolio that addresses key challenges surrounding resiliency, reliability, affordability and security requirements for our customers.

Are you passionate about creating new possibilities?

This position is part of our Siemens Power Technologies International (PTI) team. PTI is a world leader in power system analysis and provides advanced technical consulting services, world-standard analytical software programs, and professional education in power systems engineering.

We are seeking a Power Systems Consultant to join our Power System Consulting team and contribute to the planning and integration of renewables, storage, and FACTS to the electrical grid. The consultant will be working remotely in the United States for our PTI United States team.

Work options include local or fully remote anywhere in the US.
It's your role, here's the part you can play:
The core responsibilities of the Power Systems Consultant include the application of power systems planning principles, simulation and analysis of power system transient and sub-transient behaviors. In addition, the consultant will prepare reports and presentation of the study results and provide recommendation accordingly. In this role, it is crucial for the consultant to develop and maintain a strong relationship with our customers through ongoing communication. The successful candidate requires great problem-solving skills enabling quality and accuracy in a project environment. Attention to detail is a success factor.

Further responsibilities:

  • Perform power system transient analysis using appropriate RMS and EMT software tools to evaluate integration of renewable generation, battery energy storage, and FACTS
  • Prepare detailed written reports describing analyses performed, conclusions, and recommendations
  • Organize and lead small project teams ensuring deliverables are of high quality and projects are completed within budget and schedule
  • Develop automation scripts to improve the speed and accuracy of simulations and analysis
  • Provide EMT technical leadership and share knowledge with colleagues
  • Support proposal preparation by developing project plans, budgets, and timelines

Be part of our team, here's what's needed:

  • Master's degree or PhD degree in Electrical Engineering with a specialization in Power and Energy Systems
  • A minimum of 6 years of relevant experience in the electric power industry
  • In-depth knowledge of transmission system planning and/or operations
  • Industry experience performing transient analysis using PSCAD/EMTDC or EMTP-RV
  • Great English written and spoken communication skills are required

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience evaluating transient stability of large transmission systems using PSS®E, TSAT, or PSLF
  • Experience developing scripts to automate execution and analysis of simulations

We've got a lot to offer:

  • An opportunity to work with innovative and modern technologies - products and services in the field of electrification, automation, and digitalization
  • Competitive compensation (salary and bonus based on qualifications)
  • Health, dental, and vision plans with options
  • Matching 401(k)
  • Unlimited Flexible Time Off
  • Paid parental leave
  • Extensive product training and professional career development
  • Education and tuition reimbursement programs available
  • Siemens is recognized as being a top employer for diversity, sustainability, innovation, and technology. Check out this link

Find out how Siemens Grid Software is decoding the future of energy and what part you can play: https://sie.ag/DecodingTheFutureOfEnergy

Explore our Digital World

Do you want to create technologies that transform the everyday for billions of people? Our digital careers offer the opportunity to shape the next era of growth and innovation, challenging ourselves to build a better future. By creating ground breaking technologies that transform our world, we need the most innovative and diverse Digital Minds to develop tomorrow's reality. Picture yourself in the Digital World of Siemens here: www.siemens.com/careers/digitalminds.

Why you'll love working for Siemens!

  • Freedom and a healthy work- life balance- Embrace our flexible work environment with flex hours, telecommuting and digital workspaces.
  • Solve the world's most significant problems - Be part of exciting and innovative projects.
  • Engaging, challenging, and fast evolving, cutting edge technological environment.
  • Opportunities to advance your career and mentorship programs on a local and global scale.
  • Competitive total rewards package.
  • Profit sharing available.
  • Rewarding vacation entitlement with the opportunity to buy and sell your vacation depending on your lifestyle.
  • Contribute to our social responsibility initiatives focused on access to education, access to technology and sustaining communities and make a positive impact on the community.
  • Participate in our celebrations, social events and offsite business events.
  • Opportunities to contribute your innovative ideas and get paid for them!
  • Employee perks and discounts.
  • Diversity and inclusivity focused.

Siemens is proud to be an eight-time award winner of Canada's Top 100 Employers, Canada's Greenest Employers 2022, Canada's Top Employers for Young People 2023 and Greater Toronto's Top Employers 2022.

What will you do?

Siemens is looking for a Senior Technical Program Manager to help deliver a new Software-as-a-service platform for EV fleets across the world.

Key Objectives:

Delivery - As a Technical Program Manager, you will lead cross-functional teams from different locations to deliver a complex program. You will plan and manage project schedules, anticipate project risks and provide mitigation strategies. You will as need be providing escalation management recommending engineering trade-offs and decisions aligned with business goals.

Stakeholder Management - As a Technical Program Manager, you will manage conflicts, drive effective teamwork, communication and collaboration partnering across multiple teams with competing priorities by the Product Management teams.

Program Management - As a Technical Program Manager, you will identify opportunities, define and institutionalize processes for accurately capturing scope, dependencies, schedule, metrics, risks for program success and effectively communicating the program status and updates/reports to all stakeholders on a regular cadence.

  • Strategize, implement, and maintain program initiatives that adhere to organizational objectives.
  • Develop program assessment protocols for evaluation and improvement.
  • Maintain organizational standards of satisfaction, quality, and performance.
  • Oversee multiple project teams, ensuring program goals are reached.
  • Manage budget and funding channels for maximum productivity.
  • Work closely with project sponsor, cross-functional teams, and assigned engineering managers to plan and develop scope, deliverables, required resources, work plan, budget, and timing for new initiatives.
  • Develop and manage budget for projects and be accountable for delivering against established business goals/objectives.
  • Work with engineering managers to identify risks and opportunities across multiple teams.
  • Analyze, evaluate, and overcome program risks, and produce program reports for management and stakeholders.

What will you need to succeed?

  • Overall, 10-14 years of software industry experience (preferably in product development)
  • Minimum 5 years of Strong experience managing large cross-functional software projects right from inception to launch seeing the full life cycle with a deep understanding of agile methodologies.
  • Good knowledge of one or more technology stack (preferably Java, Spring boot and Cloud)
  • Preferably a PMP or Agile PM certification.
  • Experience providing cross-functional coordination with engineering, product and inter/intra team communications to technical and non-technical groups.
  • Experience working with tools to manage schedule, cost and risks of ongoing projects and provide reports to management.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, proven ability to build strong relationships and lead and influence cross-functional and partner teams.
  • Exercise good business judgement skills to find short-term solutions working cross-functionally for difficult/tricky engineering problems while not sacrificing the long-term goals.
  • Knowledge of JIRA
  • Strong drive to bring change, identifies opportunities and highly perseverant until they are realized Challenges status-quo and always pushes for new, innovative, and simple solutions.
  • Excellent communication skills, somebody who can understand the business problem/domain fast and articulate problem/solution to different audience types (technical/business)

About us.

We share our ideas and champion the people behind them.

For over 110 years, Siemens Canada has stood for engineering excellence, innovation, quality and reliability. Siemens Canada is a technology leader providing comprehensive solutions for Smart Infrastructure and Digital Industries. We make real what matters by setting the benchmark in the way we electrify, automate and digitalize the world around us. Ingenuity drives us and what we create together in yours.

Explore our Digital World

Do you want to create technologies that transform the everyday for billions of people? Our digital careers offer the opportunity to shape the next era of growth and innovation, challenging ourselves to build a better future. Picture yourself in the Digital World of Siemens here: www.siemens.com/careers/digitalminds.

Why you'll love working for Siemens!

  • Freedom and a healthy work- life balance- Embrace our flexible work environment with flex hours, telecommuting and digital workspaces.
  • Solve the world's most significant problems - Be part of exciting and innovative projects.
  • Engaging, challenging, and fast evolving, cutting edge technological environment.
  • Opportunities to advance your career and mentorship programs on a local and global scale.
  • Competitive total rewards package.
  • Profit sharing available.
  • Rewarding vacation entitlement with the opportunity to buy and sell your vacation depending on your lifestyle.
  • Contribute to our social responsibility initiatives focused on access to education, access to technology and sustaining communities and make a positive impact on the community.
  • Participate in our celebrations, social events and offsite business events.
  • Opportunities to contribute your innovative ideas and get paid for them!
  • Employee perks and discounts.
  • Diversity and inclusivity focused.

Siemens is proud to be an eight-time award winner of Canada's Top 100 Employers, Canada's Greenest Employers 2022, Canada's Top Employers for Young People 2023 and Greater Toronto's Top Employers 2022.

What will you do?

Siemens is looking for a Senior Technical Program Manager to help deliver a new Software-as-a-service platform for EV fleets across the world.

Key Objectives:

Delivery - As a Technical Program Manager, you will lead cross-functional teams from different locations to deliver a complex program. You will plan and manage project schedules, anticipate project risks and provide mitigation strategies. You will as need be providing escalation management recommending engineering trade-offs and decisions aligned with business goals.

Stakeholder Management - As a Technical Program Manager, you will manage conflicts, drive effective teamwork, communication and collaboration partnering across multiple teams with competing priorities by the Product Management teams.

Program Management - As a Technical Program Manager, you will identify opportunities, define and institutionalize processes for accurately capturing scope, dependencies, schedule, metrics, risks for program success and effectively communicating the program status and updates/reports to all stakeholders on a regular cadence.

  • Strategize, implement, and maintain program initiatives that adhere to organizational objectives.
  • Develop program assessment protocols for evaluation and improvement.
  • Maintain organizational standards of satisfaction, quality, and performance.
  • Oversee multiple project teams, ensuring program goals are reached.
  • Manage budget and funding channels for maximum productivity.
  • Work closely with project sponsor, cross-functional teams, and assigned engineering managers to plan and develop scope, deliverables, required resources, work plan, budget, and timing for new initiatives.
  • Develop and manage budget for projects and be accountable for delivering against established business goals/objectives.
  • Work with engineering managers to identify risks and opportunities across multiple teams.
  • Analyze, evaluate, and overcome program risks, and produce program reports for management and stakeholders.

What will you need to succeed?

  • Overall, 10-14 years of software industry experience (preferably in product development)
  • Minimum 5 years of Strong experience managing large cross-functional software projects right from inception to launch seeing the full life cycle with a deep understanding of agile methodologies.
  • Good knowledge of one or more technology stack (preferably Java, Spring boot and Cloud)
  • Preferably a PMP or Agile PM certification.
  • Experience providing cross-functional coordination with engineering, product and inter/intra team communications to technical and non-technical groups.
  • Experience working with tools to manage schedule, cost and risks of ongoing projects and provide reports to management.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, proven ability to build strong relationships and lead and influence cross-functional and partner teams.
  • Exercise good business judgement skills to find short-term solutions working cross-functionally for difficult/tricky engineering problems while not sacrificing the long-term goals.
  • Knowledge of JIRA
  • Strong drive to bring change, identifies opportunities and highly perseverant until they are realized Challenges status-quo and always pushes for new, innovative, and simple solutions.
  • Excellent communication skills, somebody who can understand the business problem/domain fast and articulate problem/solution to different audience types (technical/business)

About us.

We share our ideas and champion the people behind them.

For over 110 years, Siemens Canada has stood for engineering excellence, innovation, quality and reliability. Siemens Canada is a technology leader providing comprehensive solutions for Smart Infrastructure and Digital Industries. We make real what matters by setting the benchmark in the way we electrify, automate and digitalize the world around us. Ingenuity drives us and what we create together in yours.

Siemens Digital Industries Software - Where today meets tomorrow.

Let's make the difference together!
Meet the team - Video
Siemens Digital Industries (DI) is an innovation leader in automation and digitalization. Closely, collaborating with partners and customers, we care about the digital transformation in the process and discrete industries. With our Digital Enterprise portfolio, we provide and encourage companies of all sizes with an end-to-end set of products, solutions and services to integrate and digitalize the entire value chain. Meaningful optimization for the specific needs of each industry, our outstanding portfolio supports customers to achieve greater efficiency and flexibility. We are constantly adding innovations to its portfolio to integrate groundbreaking future technologies. We offer a role with responsibility, independence and the possibility to contribute proactive. We foster a teamwork culture with room for individual development

Please visit https://www.siemens.com/plm.
About the role / Segment
This role is part of the EMEA Portfolio Development and PreSales Management team and will be responsible for managing the EMEA PreSales Account Development ( PAD ) resources. The PAD team is aligned by Industry, leading and supporting strategic engagements across EMEA.

You will promote the go to market strategy of the business driving engagements through Digital Threads. You will provide coaching in, the development and delivery of customer vision, executive presentations as well as lead/coordinate and support major pursuits agreeing common approach and priorities.

Manage personnel decisions such as recruitment, training and development, performance management, etc., in line with relevant regulations. Participate in relevant Zone level meetings and/or councils contributing to planning and reporting for required activity. Contribute to global initiatives originating from agreed council priorities and strategy. Act as a role model for the Zone and Global PreSales PAD community.
Area of responsibility

  • Business Operations Management - Managing the PAD team, corporate direction, resource and budget planning. Be an escalation point for process and customer issues whilst ensuring an efficient structure within the team
  • Leadership - Define the strategic direction of the PreSales business, developing initiatives towards its evolution, process improvement and knowledge management that support the country and PreSales PAD business objectives
  • People Management - Take ownership of and drive the recruitment and selection of relevant PreSales staff, take ownership of and/or contribute to the PreSales PAD workforce and succession planning process, undertake regular performance appraisals according to Siemens HR processes, ensure appropriate learning and development plans are established for direct reports
  • Mentoring - Provide advice and coaching to PreSales team on the development and delivery of high quality Value oriented, and technical presentations, serve as a business & commercial advocate within the PreSales team to deliver guidance and advice on business rigor within customer facing agenda and software sales pursuit
  • PreSales Delivery - Support definition of Sales Account Strategy and Opportunity Planning with supporting Value Proposition, Solution Outline and presentations. For Strategic bid proposals, lead the bid team, liaise across the sales, presales and services functions to provide oversight and consultancy for, and communicate a clear vision of, the proposed solution within the industry context of the customer.
  • General - Support the organizational culture, values and reputation in company markets and with all staff, customers, suppliers, partners and regulatory/official bodies.
Your qualifications
  • Experience in a team management role in customer-facing business development presales technical environment
  • Able to understand, articulate, position and present the value of Siemens solutions in the context of an Industry, and client business value
  • Experience in leading senior level discussions
  • An excellent communicator with business acumen and strong understanding of Industry/Process
  • Proactive and energetic with a high degree of self-motivation to develop and grow the PAD team
  • Able to travel to EMEA countries and communicate effectively with multiple nationalities and cultures
  • Able to work in a EMEA role in collaboration with country teams, in a consultative and directive mode
  • Degree or equivalent professional qualification in Engineering, Manufacturing or similar field
  • Strong leadership skills with proven ability to influence/negotiate and garner support for objectives
  • Skilled diplomat with high levels of professional confidence and business acumen
  • Demonstrated effective written and oral communication skills with demonstrated experience of successfully working across organizational lines and strong executive presentation skills
  • Excellent interpersonal skills to build strong relationships
  • This role can be based out of any European country remotely
Working at Siemens Software
Why us?

Working at Siemens Software means flexibility - Choosing between working at home and the office at other times is the norm here. We offer great benefits and rewards, as you'd expect from a world leader in industrial software.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

At Siemens, we are always challenging ourselves to build a better future. We need the most innovative and diverse Digital Minds to develop tomorrow's reality.

Job Title: Head of IES Product Management for Capital Platform and SaaS

Job Reference #: 322449

Job Location: US - Remote

Siemens Software is aglobal technology powerhouse. With some of the best-known brands in the worldusing our electrical, systems, networking and embedded tools, Siemens has stoodfor engineering excellence, innovation, quality, and reliability for more than165 years. We are looking for dynamic leaders who can contribute on our journeyto build the next generation Integrated Electrical Systems (IES) portfolio. Ifyou are interested in leading a talented team that works with the bestcompanies around the globe, we'd be excited to know more about you.

Position Overview:

Siemens Digital Industry Software is seeking a passionate andexperienced product management leader within its Integrated Electrical System(IES) division to accelerate the development of electrical and electronics(E/E) systems that differentiate the world's most sophisticated products.

As Head of Product Managementfor Capital Platform & SaaS, you will lead the product strategy and roadmapfor transforming the Capital portfolio into a world classSaaS offering. In addition, you will drive enhancementsto the Capital platform technology, including data management, extensibility,and integration to MCAD and PLM systems. E/E systems are an integral part ofthe Siemens Xcelerator platform and ecosystem. A key part of your responsibilitywill be to provide and realize a vision for how Capital can enhance and takeSiemens Xcelerator to the next level.

The Capital software portfolio provides solutions for E/E systems,software architectures, network communications, and embedded softwaredevelopment capabilities across industries, including automotive andtransportation, aerospace and defense, heavy equipment, and marine.

As part of the IES seniorleadership team, you will actively participate in strategic planning, businessreviews, Capital release planning/execution, and key customer engagements. Inthis role you will gain visibility across the whole Siemens organization as youwork closely with your peers in other divisions.

Responsibilities:

  • Support, lead, and develop a global team of technical product managers
  • Develop SaaS/cloud transformation strategy, including pricing and packaging models for products and solutions
  • Work closely with sales and customers to achieve revenue goals, support product adoption, and understand customer requirements
  • Define investment strategies and product roadmaps
  • Work with product owners and product development to facilitate planning and execution of the investment strategy and realization of product roadmap objectives
  • Develop go-to-market strategy and training collateral
  • Evangelize products and solutions to create excitement and articulate value among industry and sales teams and external stakeholders and customers
  • Work collaboratively with corporate functions and other business segments

Knowledge/Skills, Education, and Experience:

We are seeking an individualwho is a business and technical thought leader and is a recognized authority inthis area. Candidates preferably have 10+ years' experience product management,preferably in the automotive or aerospace electrical design industry, with afocus on cloud transformation, data management, and inter-tool integration.

Necessary skills and experience for this position:

  • Bachelor's degree in engineering, computer science or other technical discipline
  • Enthusiasm for software technology, ideally with experience specifying new enterprise software products and/or deploying enterprise IT systems
  • An ability to think in commercial terms and to drive business initiatives
  • Strong customer-facing and relationship building skills coupled with the ability to communicate in clear, business-oriented terms Fluent spoken and written English
  • Advanced analytical skills with the ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to communicate well with different types and size of audiences
  • Quick learner, who adapts well to changes in a fast-paced environment and has a strong interest in learning and applying new technology to solve problems through teamwork and innovative solutions.
  • Experience with enterprise agile and scrum development practices

Preferred Knowledge/Skills, Education, and Experience

  • Advanced degree e.g., MBA
  • Expert knowledge of the use of software to manage complex electrical data
  • Extensive working experience on modern Cloud/SaaS solutions and ideally also including traditional desktop products (5-10 years)
  • A track record of publications or presenting at conferences in this domain
  • Experience dealing with complex data models and inter-tool integrations
  • Experience working in discrete manufacturing industry a plus

Explore our Digital World

Do you want to create technologies that transform the everyday for billions of people? Our digital careers offer the opportunity to shape the next era of growth and innovation, challenging ourselves to build a better future. By creating ground breaking technologies that transform our world, we need the most innovative and diverse Digital Minds to develop tomorrow's reality. Picture yourself in the Digital World of Siemens here: www.siemens.com/careers/digitalminds.

Why you'll love working for Siemens!

  • Freedom and a healthy work- life balance- Embrace our flexible work environment with flex hours, telecommuting and digital workspaces.
  • Solve the world's most significant problems - Be part of exciting and innovative projects.
  • Engaging, challenging, and fast evolving, cutting edge technological environment.
  • Opportunities to advance your career and mentorship programs on a local and global scale.
  • Competitive total rewards package.
  • Profit sharing available.
  • Rewarding vacation entitlement with the opportunity to buy and sell your vacation depending on your lifestyle.
  • Contribute to our social responsibility initiatives focused on access to education, access to technology and sustaining communities and make a positive impact on the community.
  • Participate in our celebrations, social events and offsite business events.
  • Opportunities to contribute your innovative ideas and get paid for them!
  • Employee perks and discounts.
  • Diversity and inclusivity focused.

Siemens is proud to be an eight-time award winner of Canada's Top 100 Employers, Canada's Greenest Employers 2022, Canada's Top Employers for Young People 2023 and Greater Toronto's Top Employers 2022.

What will you do?

Siemens is looking for a Senior Technical Program Manager to help deliver a new Software-as-a-service platform for EV fleets across the world.

Key Objectives:

Delivery - As a Technical Program Manager, you will lead cross-functional teams from different locations to deliver a complex program. You will plan and manage project schedules, anticipate project risks and provide mitigation strategies. You will as need be providing escalation management recommending engineering trade-offs and decisions aligned with business goals.

Stakeholder Management - As a Technical Program Manager, you will manage conflicts, drive effective teamwork, communication and collaboration partnering across multiple teams with competing priorities by the Product Management teams.

Program Management - As a Technical Program Manager, you will identify opportunities, define and institutionalize processes for accurately capturing scope, dependencies, schedule, metrics, risks for program success and effectively communicating the program status and updates/reports to all stakeholders on a regular cadence.

  • Strategize, implement, and maintain program initiatives that adhere to organizational objectives.
  • Develop program assessment protocols for evaluation and improvement.
  • Maintain organizational standards of satisfaction, quality, and performance.
  • Oversee multiple project teams, ensuring program goals are reached.
  • Manage budget and funding channels for maximum productivity.
  • Work closely with project sponsor, cross-functional teams, and assigned engineering managers to plan and develop scope, deliverables, required resources, work plan, budget, and timing for new initiatives.
  • Develop and manage budget for projects and be accountable for delivering against established business goals/objectives.
  • Work with engineering managers to identify risks and opportunities across multiple teams.
  • Analyze, evaluate, and overcome program risks, and produce program reports for management and stakeholders.

What will you need to succeed?

  • Overall, 10-14 years of software industry experience (preferably in product development)
  • Minimum 5 years of Strong experience managing large cross-functional software projects right from inception to launch seeing the full life cycle with a deep understanding of agile methodologies.
  • Good knowledge of one or more technology stack (preferably Java, Spring boot and Cloud)
  • Preferably a PMP or Agile PM certification.
  • Experience providing cross-functional coordination with engineering, product and inter/intra team communications to technical and non-technical groups.
  • Experience working with tools to manage schedule, cost and risks of ongoing projects and provide reports to management.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, proven ability to build strong relationships and lead and influence cross-functional and partner teams.
  • Exercise good business judgement skills to find short-term solutions working cross-functionally for difficult/tricky engineering problems while not sacrificing the long-term goals.
  • Knowledge of JIRA
  • Strong drive to bring change, identifies opportunities and highly perseverant until they are realized Challenges status-quo and always pushes for new, innovative, and simple solutions.
  • Excellent communication skills, somebody who can understand the business problem/domain fast and articulate problem/solution to different audience types (technical/business)

About us.

We share our ideas and champion the people behind them.

For over 110 years, Siemens Canada has stood for engineering excellence, innovation, quality and reliability. Siemens Canada is a technology leader providing comprehensive solutions for Smart Infrastructure and Digital Industries. We make real what matters by setting the benchmark in the way we electrify, automate and digitalize the world around us. Ingenuity drives us and what we create together in yours.

Company: Siemens

Job Title: Head of IES Product Management for Capital Platform and SaaS

Job Reference #: 322449

Job Location: US - Remote

Siemens Software is aglobal technology powerhouse. With some of the best-known brands in the worldusing our electrical, systems, networking and embedded tools, Siemens has stoodfor engineering excellence, innovation, quality, and reliability for more than165 years. We are looking for dynamic leaders who can contribute on our journeyto build the next generation Integrated Electrical Systems (IES) portfolio. Ifyou are interested in leading a talented team that works with the bestcompanies around the globe, we'd be excited to know more about you.

Position Overview:

Siemens Digital Industry Software is seeking a passionate andexperienced product management leader within its Integrated Electrical System(IES) division to accelerate the development of electrical and electronics(E/E) systems that differentiate the world's most sophisticated products.

As Head of Product Managementfor Capital Platform & SaaS, you will lead the product strategy and roadmapfor transforming the Capital portfolio into a world classSaaS offering. In addition, you will drive enhancementsto the Capital platform technology, including data management, extensibility,and integration to MCAD and PLM systems. E/E systems are an integral part ofthe Siemens Xcelerator platform and ecosystem. A key part of your responsibilitywill be to provide and realize a vision for how Capital can enhance and takeSiemens Xcelerator to the next level.

The Capital software portfolio provides solutions for E/E systems,software architectures, network communications, and embedded softwaredevelopment capabilities across industries, including automotive andtransportation, aerospace and defense, heavy equipment, and marine.

As part of the IES seniorleadership team, you will actively participate in strategic planning, businessreviews, Capital release planning/execution, and key customer engagements. Inthis role you will gain visibility across the whole Siemens organization as youwork closely with your peers in other divisions.

Responsibilities:

  • Support, lead, and develop a global team of technical product managers
  • Develop SaaS/cloud transformation strategy, including pricing and packaging models for products and solutions
  • Work closely with sales and customers to achieve revenue goals, support product adoption, and understand customer requirements
  • Define investment strategies and product roadmaps
  • Work with product owners and product development to facilitate planning and execution of the investment strategy and realization of product roadmap objectives
  • Develop go-to-market strategy and training collateral
  • Evangelize products and solutions to create excitement and articulate value among industry and sales teams and external stakeholders and customers
  • Work collaboratively with corporate functions and other business segments

Knowledge/Skills, Education, and Experience:

We are seeking an individualwho is a business and technical thought leader and is a recognized authority inthis area. Candidates preferably have 10+ years' experience product management,preferably in the automotive or aerospace electrical design industry, with afocus on cloud transformation, data management, and inter-tool integration.

Necessary skills and experience for this position:

  • Bachelor's degree in engineering, computer science or other technical discipline
  • Enthusiasm for software technology, ideally with experience specifying new enterprise software products and/or deploying enterprise IT systems
  • An ability to think in commercial terms and to drive business initiatives
  • Strong customer-facing and relationship building skills coupled with the ability to communicate in clear, business-oriented terms Fluent spoken and written English
  • Advanced analytical skills with the ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to communicate well with different types and size of audiences
  • Quick learner, who adapts well to changes in a fast-paced environment and has a strong interest in learning and applying new technology to solve problems through teamwork and innovative solutions.
  • Experience with enterprise agile and scrum development practices

Preferred Knowledge/Skills, Education, and Experience

  • Advanced degree e.g., MBA
  • Expert knowledge of the use of software to manage complex electrical data
  • Extensive working experience on modern Cloud/SaaS solutions and ideally also including traditional desktop products (5-10 years)
  • A track record of publications or presenting at conferences in this domain
  • Experience dealing with complex data models and inter-tool integrations
  • Experience working in discrete manufacturing industry a plus

Thesalary range for this position is $136,700 to $246,100 and this role iseligible to earn incentive compensation. The actual compensation offered isbased on the successful candidate's work location as well as additionalfactors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education/training. Siemensoffers a variety of health and wellness benefits to employees. Detailsregarding our benefits can be found here: www.benefitsquickstart.com.In addition, this position is eligible for time off in accordance with Companypolicies, including paid sick leave, paid parental leave, PTO (for non-exemptemployees) or non-accrued flexible vacation (for exempt employees).

Job Title
Field Service Engineer - Ann Arbor, Michigan Area

Job Description

Field Service Engineer

The Field Service Engineer position supports the Imaging Systems business within an assigned geographical area. This position will be responsible for customer relationship management through the effective use of technical knowledge to install, troubleshoot, service, and maintain equipment at customer sites; generate service revenue; adherence to state and federal regulatory requirements.

Your role:

Customer Ownership

  • Build credibility and trust with customers by conducting pro-active customer visits.
  • Provide appropriate, timely, and regular communications to customer and internal key stakeholders regarding customer and equipment issues.
  • Demonstrate a sense of urgency to identify and resolve customer issues. Follow the appropriate escalation process.
  • Provide exceptional customer service by adhering to customer entitlements, setting clear expectations, meeting commitments and arrival times. Understand customer's business and competitive environment.
  • Generate revenue growth by offering solutions aligned with service portfolio.
Teamwork
  • Adopt, develop and implement best practices.
  • Proactively schedules activities & makes him/herself available to assist others.
  • Seeks out opportunities to increase capability and capacity (i.e. may be required to become qualified in multiple modalities, learns new tools). Assists in identifying training gaps within the team.
  • Actively seeks to mentor others.
  • Actively participates as a member of regional work team and works to improve team processes.
Compliance
  • Operate under the required knowledge of State and Federal regulatory requirements. Adheres to established training, quality, and safety requirements.
  • Manages company assets effectively in accordance with established Philips processes and guidelines including labor time, parts ordering and returns, tools and test equipment calibration, purchase orders, equipment, company vehicles, business expenditures, etc.
  • Performs all administrative duties within established Philips and regulatory timeframes including timesheets, service work orders, expense reports, Field Change Orders, preventative maintenance, installation documents, site and service documentation, and other related paperwork.
Technical
  • Must be qualified and perform work in at least one modality. May be asked to become qualified in and perform work in multiple modalities. Maintains knowledge of technical advances and current industry trends. Seeks out formal and informal training opportunities.
  • Independently resolve equipment and customer issues.
  • Independently complete PMs, FCOs, installations, and all related tasks.
  • Independently diagnose and resolve electronic, network, and mechanical problems.
  • Utilize tools, support, resources and escalation processes within required time frames to resolve customer and system problems timely and effectively.
  • May be asked to perform service work remotely providing telephone, remote technical support, and remote diagnostics to external healthcare customers and field partners in order to resolve customer equipment issues and initiate escalation, if appropriate.
Physical Demands and Work Environment
  • Job operates in the hospital/medical environment and remotely from home office location.
  • Potential exposure to hazardous physical, chemical, radiological and biological agents and loud noise.
  • May work in environments where devices producing one or more of the following may be in use: high levels of radiation, high magnetic fields, high voltages, compressed and liquefied gases, and radioactive materials. Strict adherence to corporate and site safety procedures is mandatory.
  • Frequently in contact with electrical equipment.
  • This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, medical test equipment.
  • Average driving is 1-4 hours daily and may exceed 50% at times. Occasional overnight stays and travel by air or train may be required.
  • Responsible for carrying and monitoring company cell phone and being available and responsive during scheduled and non-scheduled hours, except during rest and meal periods as required by applicable state law.
  • Must be flexible in working hours as this position will require customer support during non-regular business hours, mandatory overtime on short notice, and/or weekend work as necessary.
  • May work from ladders or scaffolding, on occasion.
  • Ability to participate in an on-call rotation to provide customer support.
  • Regularly speaks, hears, and views computers.
  • Frequently lift, carry, push, or pull up to 20 pounds. Occasionally lift or carry up to 100 pounds, with assistance available when lifting or carrying items over 50 pounds.
  • Occasionally twist, and crawl.
  • Frequently stand, walk, stoop, kneel, and extended reach.
  • Regular grasping and repetitive hand movements.
  • Occasional use of vibrating tools.
  • Use of personal protective equipment may be required including, but not limited to, radiation monitoring badge, safety glasses, hard hat, hard toed shoes, and medical rubber gloves.
  • May be required to adhere to certification/credentialing required by the Customer in connection with admission into its facilities to perform job duties.
    • Customer requirements may include, but are not limited to drug testing and immunizations as dictated by the customer or facility policy.
You're the right fit if:
  • Associate Degree in electronics or equivalent combination of education and experience. At least 2 years' experience in diagnostic imaging or 4 years' experience in the electronics industry, preferably in a field service environment

  • Work collaboratively with corporate functions and other business segments

Knowledge/Skills, Education, and Experience:

We are seeking an individualwho is a business and technical thought leader and is a recognized authority inthis area. Candidates preferably have 10+ years' experience product management,preferably in the automotive or aerospace electrical design industry, with afocus on cloud transformation, data management, and inter-tool integration.

Necessary skills and experience for this position:

  • Bachelor's degree in engineering, computer science or other technical discipline
  • Enthusiasm for software technology, ideally with experience specifying new enterprise software products and/or deploying enterprise IT systems
  • An ability to think in commercial terms and to drive business initiatives
  • Strong customer-facing and relationship building skills coupled with the ability to communicate in clear, business-oriented terms Fluent spoken and written English
  • Advanced analytical skills with the ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to communicate well with different types and size of audiences
  • Quick learner, who adapts well to changes in a fast-paced environment and has a strong interest in learning and applying new technology to solve problems through teamwork and innovative solutions.
  • Experience with enterprise agile and scrum development practices

Preferred Knowledge/Skills, Education, and Experience

  • Advanced degree e.g., MBA
  • Expert knowledge of the use of software to manage complex electrical data
  • Extensive working experience on modern Cloud/SaaS solutions and ideally also including traditional desktop products (5-10 years)
  • A track record of publications or presenting at conferences in this domain
  • Experience dealing with complex data models and inter-tool integrations
  • Experience working in discrete manufacturing industry a plus

Thesalary range for this position is $136,700 to $246,100 and this role iseligible to earn incentive compensation. The actual compensation offered isbased on the successful candidate's work location as well as additionalfactors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education/training. Siemensoffers a variety of health and wellness benefits to employees. Detailsregarding our benefits can be found here: www.benefitsquickstart.com.In addition, this position is eligible for time off in accordance with Companypolicies, including paid sick leave, paid parental leave, PTO (for non-exemptemployees) or non-accrued flexible vacation (for exempt employees).
